New Records: Juan Soto hit a three-run homer with two outs in the 10th inning, helping the New York Yankees advance to the World Series
Key Match Events: Juan Soto's three-run homer in the 10th inning was the game-winner for the Yankees
Giancarlo Stanton hit a two-run homer for the Yankees
The Guardians rallied to win Game 3 on two, two-run homers in their last two at-bats, and the Yankees held on to win Game 4 after blowing a four-run lead
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees will try to win their 28th title against either the New York Mets or Los Angeles Dodgers
The franchise remains without a title since 1948, baseball's current longest drought
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees will face the winner of the NLCS between the Mets and Dodgers in the World Series
The team's surprising season under first-year manager Stephen Vogt ended just short of a World Series
Others: The game was a nail-biter, with all three games at Progressive Field being close contests
